column15: What is your annual household income?
column16: What was your overall impression of this event (quality, lighting, sound, value)?
column17: Please share any other suggestions or ideas that would help us enhance your experience at Gesa Power House Theatre. If you would like someone to respond to your feedback, please include your contact information. Thank you!

column16: Great!
Excellent
Excellent!
column17: Love these shows  at the gesa theater!

column16: Phenomenal! We laughed so hard. We also had our three early 20’s children and they were cracking up just as hard! I’m going to find him other places and tell friends. So great!
4 out of 5.   Wish the closing had been a bit more organized to truly celebrate the turn of the year
It was a good fun event,  sound was great,  lighting was great.  I loved that you added champagne and the East Coast New Years Celebration.
column17:
It was a great show,  great job. 
My only feedback is that the railing right in front of the BB seating was very low and I assume it is for viewing purposes but it was scary walking by that especially for someone scared of heights and also not great with balance. Otherwise it was a great evening.  Thank you!

column16: Very fun
Very nice
Excellent
in center of B row it's a bit strange to hear the sound coming from speakers to the side instead of from performer 12 ft. in front of you.
All good
Great event!  Maybe have the upstairs room open before the show for patrons to have a beverage without blocking the lobby.
Staff is very friendly and inviting. The building is very nice. Lighting is adequate.  We had a little difficulty hearing the comedian. Probably because of the soft tone of his voice.

Mr. Andrew Sleighter is a comedian that has honed his craft.  He was pretty funny and knows how to get the audience involved.  I would recommend him to others and hope he returns some day soon with a new slate of comedic originals.  Thanks for giving him a stage to stand on and to send us into 2024 on a positive note.
column17: As the Powerhouse Theater becomes more popular and makes enough money for improvements, please consider making changes to the facility.  I think it could be a better venue over time if more funds would be spent to enhance the interior, but not take away from the historic nature of the building.  Thanks.

column16: We thought the event was great! Sound and lighting were great, the comic was very enjoyable, and the tickets were reasonably priced. I thought the champagne toast was a very nice thought, but wasn't executed very well.
column17: This was our first time to the theater, and we really enjoyed the event! I realize that there may be very little that can be done about this, but my main comment for things to improve would be the congestion of the lobby before the show. I realize there are several things that need to take place (will call, ticket scanning, coat check, bar, etc.) in a relatively small space, but the crowding means people have to wait outside for a while so that they can squeeze between people to get through the lobby. Perhaps longer hours for the bar, moving will call, or something like that would be helpful for reducing congestion. That said, the staff were all very friendly, welcoming, and helpful!

column16: Very well done. Fun atmosphere in a beautiful theater, everyone friendly, comedian very funny

Excellent event! We never stopped laughing for almost 2 hours. The seats were comfortable and the staff were welcoming.  Thankfully, intermission was long enough to get everyone through the bathrooms.
Great night!
Excellent performer

Ticket prices were high for what it was...a good show but I had heard a good amount of the material previously on his posted videos...would have been nice to have more new material--especially for the new year-since it was advertised as a NYE special...was expecting new material not a lot of repeated/old jokes...
column17: Having a military/veteran discount available would be nice. Also, consistency in pricing on the website from the main page throughout the event pages...Many times it differs and is conflicting...ticket pricing info should be clear and concise at a minimum, especially at the prices being charged. These aren't discount/cheap tickets. Another little detail--When popcorn is served in the lobby - Make it fresh...Nothing says "We got you good" like paying $4 for a tiny bag of popcorn...only to find out it is STALE. That's just bad business and acting in bad faith

column16:
Andrew's voice was a little hard to distinguish at times, not sure if it was the mic or that he talked fairly fast. All in all it was allot of fun. 
We look foreword to next years New Years eve show, we have been at most of the New Years shows since the theatre started, they've all been enjoyable. 
  Thank You very much. Darrin and Lori.
